classification_rules.rule: Describe what you actually see - be specific and concrete.
Write in complete sentences, not bullet points or fragments.
Include location information (where on the page content appears).
Note relationships between different content areas if relevant.
Be thorough but concise - capture all significant content without padding.
If content is unclear due to image quality, say so honestly.
Use proper JSON formatting with no syntax errors.

enhancement_rules.rule: Set enhancement_recommended=true for: - Handwritten content (notes, annotations, manuscripts) - Annotations over printed text (margin notes, corrections) - Ancient scripts (hieroglyphics) - Visible degradation (yellowing, fading, foxing, noise) - Historical documents with aged paper - Low contrast text that is difficult to read - Faded ink or pencil marks

Set enhancement_recommended=false for: - Clean printed/digital content - Modern tables and charts with clear lines - Clear diagrams with good contrast - High-quality scans of modern documents - Text that is already easily readable

Use these enhancement_reason values: - "historical_manuscript" - aged handwritten documents - "faded_handwriting" - handwriting with poor contrast - "handwritten_annotations" - notes written over other content - "degraded_scan" - poor quality scan with noise/blur - "ancient_script" - hieroglyphics, etc. - "low_contrast" - text difficult to distinguish from background
